page.title: 04New Lodge Estate.
page.content: The estate originally extended from New Lodge itself down to the River Thames. The house stands in extensive {gardens}with many lovely trees. They are cared for by 1 old gardener.Head gardeners used to live in the bothie. The greenhouses have underfloor heating. There was an ice house which was built 15-20 metres below ground. The courtyard is cobbled and the old stables have flats above.An unusual grass semicircle provided a platform for ladies to enter the carriages without having to raise their skirts. The crest of the original owner Van de Weyer can be seen on many buildings.A {church}was built on the estate and in 1871 Queen Victoria created the{Parish {of Braywood.}It was deconsecrated in the 1950's,a new church built and the Parish became part of{Bray Parish.}The estate was sold off in parts in 1911.
